column2: Note  : This is a FULLTIME, CONTRACTUAL and WORK-FROM-HOME Role : Objective of this role  :    - The successful candidate will play a crucial role in analyzing clinical research studies related to holistic healthcare interventions including managing protocols. - This role requires a strong background in clinical research methodologies, a commitment to ethical standards, and a passion for advancing holistic approaches to healthcare.  Roles and Responsibilities      Analyze Data and Report Findings Analyse existing and   new data to find a correlation between lifestyle and health conditions Apply various   statistical tests to find out if the hypothesis is true or false Compare the data   outcomes of our case studies with the available/existing   published research and highlight important points Translate the data   into charts and graphs Report flaws in data collection, if any   Blogs and Research Papers Write blogs based   on research backed with facts and figures   Study Design and Planning Develop and   design clinical research protocols for holistic healthcare studies. Plan and   coordinate all aspects of research studies, including clients data, data   collection on various resources, and analysis.   Ethical Compliance Ensure research activities comply with ethical standards, regulatory requirements,   and industry best practices. Maintain documentation of ethical approval processes.   Quality Assurance Implementing   quality control measures to ensure the accuracy and reliability of data. Attention to detail in all stages of the research process.   Adherence and Brand Value Ensure adherence to the 4 pillars of holistic health and maintain a healthy   lifestyle and remain fit Promote the brand value and the vision of the company Skills for the Role  :   Clinical Research Methodologies Proficiency   in designing and implementing clinical research protocols. Experience with both quantitative and qualitative research methodologies.   Project Management Strong   project management skills to oversee the entire research process. Ability to manage timelines, resources, and budgets effectively.   Communication Skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Ability to present complex research findings in a clear   and accessible manner.   Continuous Learning Commitment to continuous professional development. Staying informed about emerging trends and technologies   in clinical research.   Critical Thinking Strong analytical and critical thinking skills for   interpreting research results. Problem-solving ability in addressing challenges during   research.   Education :  Master's or Ph.D. in Clinical Research,   Public Health, or a related field.   Work Experience  7+ years experience in clinical   research with a focus on holistic healthcare interventions. Experience in   leading clinical research will be an added advantage.
column11: Clinical Research, Clinical Data Management

column2: Susoft Solutions is looking forMedical Transcriptionist to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      A medical transcriptionist is responsible for listening to recordings made by healthcare professionals, such as doctors or nurses, and accurately transcribing them into written reports      These reports include patient history, physical examination notes, operative reports, consultation notes, discharge summaries, and other medical documents      The transcriptionist ensures that the transcribed documents are error-free, properly formatted, and comply with medical transcription guidelines and industry standards          Key Responsibilities:          Transcription: Listen to audio recordings of dictated medical reports and accurately transcribe them into written documents using word processing software or specialized transcription software      Edit and Proofread: Review transcribed documents for accuracy, grammar, punctuation, and clarity      Edit and proofread documents to ensure they meet quality standards and are free of errors      Medical Terminology: Possess a strong understanding of medical terminology, anatomy, physiology, pharmacology, and procedures to accurately transcribe medical reports      Compliance: Adhere to medical transcription guidelines, standards, and legal requirements, including patient confidentiality (HIPAA compliance) and other regulatory guidelines      Formatting: Format transcribed documents according to specified guidelines, including margins, font styles, and document structure      Research: Conduct research as needed to clarify medical terms, procedures, or diagnoses mentioned in the dictation      Communication: Collaborate with healthcare professionals, transcription team members, and supervisors to clarify dictation, address transcription issues, and ensure accuracy in medical reports      Time Management: Manage workload efficiently to meet transcription deadlines and prioritize tasks effectively

column2: Medical transcriptionists are responsible for listening to voice recordings that physicians and other healthcare professionals make and convert them into written reports.                Job Responsibilities            Proofread / Quality Check medical reports, summaries, office visit notes and other medical documents from recorded messages from health care providers.      Provide online copies of transcribed documents to physicians or other providers for review and signature, making corrections or changes as noted.      Familiarity with proper grammar, spelling and sentence structure as well as medical jargon and abbreviations for accuracy.      Listening to physician-patient visit conversations and create clinical documentation within EHRs.      Create and summarize findings and insights into highly structured clinical notes with sections; history of present illness, review of systems, physical examination, and plan details, PMFSH etc.      Adhere to quality guidelines established as per quality protocols.      Create more primary scribes within the organization.      Meet the productivity expectations as per the budget.      Maintain strict adherence to patient confidentiality according to provider standards and government regulations. Should have been designated as Proofer / Editor / Quality on papers        Knowledge of medical terminologies.      Exceptional control over grammar, spelling and punctuation.      Ability to concentrate for longer period of time.      Typing Proficiency.      Ability to Multitask. Demonstrate Critical Thinking and Attention to Detail.      Passion for Accuracy & Trainability

column2: Employment Type:  Full Time, Permanent UG :  B.Sc in Nursing, Any Graduate, B.Pharma in Any Specialization Experience :  6 - 12 yrs as Medical Scribe Work Mode :  Work from Office Office           :   Ganapathy, Coimbatore Shift Time :  6.30 pm to 3.30 am(US Shifts) Role:  Healthcare & Life Sciences - Other Industry Type:  Medical Services / Hospital Salary will be Par as per Market standards Note : Candidates who have minimum 6-12 yrs of relevant live scribing/nursing experience, and can work from office can only apply for this role. JOB SUMMARY: As a Senior Medical Scribe, you will work remotely to assist healthcare providers in documenting patient interactions and maintaining accurate electronic health records. Your primary responsibility is to capture and transcribe medical information during patient visits, ensuring completeness, accuracy, and compliance with established guidelines. This role requires strong attention to detail, medical terminology proficiency, and the ability to work collaboratively with healthcare professionals. Candidates who are passionate about medicine and desire to impact the future of healthcare are desired. Your Secondary responsibility would be to train a team of Scribe Executives for different specialty Doctors. Role & responsibilities 1)   Provide real-time medical scribing of charts upon request, capturing all relevant information accurately and promptly. 2)   Create e-prescriptions as directed by the provider. 3)   Review and verify the accuracy of the information in the patient's progress notes and make necessary corrections. 4)   Ensure efficient and accurate patient appointments during the incoming or outgoing patient calls. 5)   Maintain quality communication with patients for appointment reminders, schedules, follow ups and any inquiries. 6)   Coordinate both the incoming and outgoing patient referrals over the call. 7)   Expedite all backend operations including incoming/outgoing faxes, prior authorizations, lab reports, chart preparation, etc. 8)   Accurately assign and encode billing codes by insurance guidelines for each patient's progress notes. 9)   Ensure that all performed procedures are appropriately documented and encoded in the patient's progress notes. 10)   Conduct a thorough review of posted results to identify and report any discrepancies. 11)   Assist the doctor/provider in data and chart completion in the absence of an in-person medical scribe. Preferred candidate profile . Required in a medical office, clinical or healthcare documentation or similar academic setting. Familiarity with medical terminology & medical summarization. Excellent English professional writing skills; including advanced proficiency in grammar and spelling. Excellent listening skills and ability to understand diverse accents and dialects of physicians, their staff, and patients. Ability to work independently in a secure and private location with a reliable high-speed internet connection. Ability to participate in live video chat and screen sharing sessions for training. KEY COMPETENCIES: 1)   Must be a Nurse or Nursing graduate or any medical degree with all adequate medical terminology preferably with Clinical Experience 2)   High proficiency in English (US Accent added advantage) 3)   Experience in handling EHR/EMR medical softwares will be added advantage. 4)   A typing speed of at least 50 wpm and the ability to accurately handle large volumes of data efficiently. 5)   Proficiency in MS Office, including Electronic Medical Records, and the ability to quickly learn new systems and tools.

column2: It is important to evaluate and match your capabilities to our current needs. After completing this process, candidates who meet our requirements and current account needs will be contacted to discuss employment opportunities. All other applications will be kept on file for future consideration.          Candidates will need to have minimum experience of one year in any one of the following areas:            Acute Care        Candidates need at least one year of full-time experience working either for a hospital or for a service transcribing in-patient reports for the Medical Records department of a hospital.          Experience should include daily exposure to reports (History and Physical reports, consultations, operative and emergency room reports, and discharge summaries) for a wide variety of of specialties and dictators.          Multi-specialty clinic    Candidates must have a minimum of one year of experience transcribing multi-specialty clinic dictation.      Multi-specialty experience is defined as experience in transcribing at least three different specialties concurrently.      Overall, experience with a minimum of 3-4 specialties within the past five years is preferred    Emergency Room Reports    Candidates need one or more years of experience transcribing ER reports for a hospital.            Radiology        Candidates must have at least two years of experience transcribing X-rays, MRIs, CT scans, Nuclear Medicine, ultrasounds and mammograms for either a hospital or imaging clinic.      Send your resume to hr@orientalsolutions.com, if you feel you possess the necessary acumen and qualifications

column2: Nature of Job:    Remote       The responsibilities of this job include, but are not limited to, the following:          Transcribing and editing recorded material (e.g., patient histories and physicals, consult letters and notes, physician correspondence, x-ray reports, etc.);      Verifying accuracy of patient information (e.g., name, identification number, etc.);      Matching the complaint to diagnosis using Medical Records needing review for specific date reports for every date of service transcribed;      Verifying accuracy of transcription for correct punctuation, grammar and spelling;      Researching via appropriate reference materials in order to correct dictated language into concise, accurate, and understandable text;      Informing the Team Lead when there are questions and inconsistencies in the dictated language that require assistance with correction;      Flagging charts that are dictated in the incorrect pool for the supervisor so they can be moved to the proper pool;      Sending demographic information regarding flagged dictations to the Transcription Assistant to be addressed by dictator(s);      Meeting the minimum daily line requirements as directed.          Minimum education and professional requirements include, but are not limited to, the following:          High school diploma required;      Formal training through an accredited transcription program preferred;      Five or more years of experience as a medical transcriptionist in a hospital, urgent care facility, or medical specialty preferred;      Knowledge of medical transcription guidelines and practices;      Excellent skills in English usage, grammar, punctuation, and style;      Ability to use an extensive array of professional reference materials;      Ability to operate word processing equipment, dictation and transcription equipment, and other equipment as specified;      Ability to work independently with minimal or no supervision;      Proficiency in a variety of Microsoft applications and software products, as well as transcription-specific software products;      Ability to concentrate and work under pressure with no time constraints;      Ability to sit for extended periods of time;      Ability to lift up to 40 lbs.;

column2: Medical Transcriptionist Job Description Medical transcriptionists type up written reports of the audio files doctors record after they interact with patients.  These written reports are then included in the patients medical record.  Medical transcription editors are specialized medical transcriptionists who correct and edit written reports created by speech recognition software,  which automatically translates the doctors dictation into text.  Rs. 6000- Rs. 20000 Pm Candidate Profile  Good Communication Skills Time Management  Good at visualization 6 months- 6 years Contact Person HR Head Email ID hr@kelconixservices. com

column2: TransDyne is in the IT&ITES industry for nearly two decades. Our healthcare BPO division is one of the largest in India. An unmatched quality of service helps us in maintaining and broadening client relationships.  We currently have openings in the night shift for Medical Scribe, both day and nightshift for Trainee Process Specialist and Trainee Process Associate positions. A  Medical Scribe  is a person or a paraprofessional, who specializes in charting physician-patient encounters in real time, such as during medical examinations. Experience as a Doctors Assistant/Patient coordinator/Staff Nurse etc., will be an added advantage.  A  Process Associate  transcribes patient records based on dictations received from doctors in the U.S. This is the first level in the transcription process. The company provides all the training required to be a good Process Associate. A  Process Specialist  checks the work of different Process Associates, makes changes wherever necessary and ensures documents are delivered with 100% quality to the client. The company provides all the training required to be a good Process Specialist. About the career: This is an evergreen industry, unlikely to be affected by factors like recession, changes in spending patterns, inflation etc. as it relates to the healthcare field. Getting a job with TransDyne as a Medical Scribe, Process Associate or Specialist is based only on merit. This career is suitable for anybody who has a flair for English and Medicine. Your career graph in TransDyne depends on your performance, and not on your age, qualification or length of service. Some of the salient features of a career with TransDyne are: Secure and stable jobs. Attractive salary package of upto 2.3 LPA for Medical Scribe, upto 1.92 LPA for Process Specialist and upto 1.25 LPA for Process Associate + Incentives. Fast track promotions & periodic performance appraisals. Free training with performance based stipend during training. What we need from you: You should be very good at Written English. You should be willing to commit yourself for at least two and half year term with the company. You should be a self-starter with an aptitude for learning. The selection process consists of a simple English language test and a personal interview. The selection procedure is same for all the three positions mentioned above. The interviewer at the time of your interview will decide for which position you would be suitable for based on your performance in the test and your abilities.  If you are interested, please  walk-in between 10:00 am and 4:30 pm on any weekday (Mon-Sat)  to any of the two addresses given below:  HEAD OFFICE TransDyne IT Services Pvt. Ltd.  MPR Residency, First Floor  Sai Baba Temple Lane  Dwarakapuri Colony  Punjagutta, Hyderabad 82    VIJAYAWADA: TransDyne IT Services Pvt. Ltd.   4th floor, Rajeshwari Nilayam,   Lane Adjacent to NAC Jewellers,   M.G Road, Vijayawada - 520 010    You may refer this job to all your friends, who are looking for a stable and secure career.  Candidates from any academic background can apply to these vacancies including B.Tech, MBA, MCA, M.Tech, M.com. Etc.,  For any queries/clarifications please contact through telephone on  040-30222666  or e-mail us on hrd@transdyne.in .
